title: 3 Ways to Manage Your Passwords with KeePass

steps.title: Download KeePass by navigating here.
steps.content: Download KeePass by navigating here .

steps.title: Launch "KeePass".
steps.content: Launch "KeePass".

steps.title: Click on the "New" button.
steps.content: Click on the "New" button. You should find the button when KeePass opens up.

steps.title: Press the "Save" button.
steps.content: Press the "Save" button.

steps.title: Type in your Master Password and click the "OK" button.
steps.content: Type in your Master Password and click the "OK" button. Pick a master password that you will easily remember.

steps.title: Click the "OK" button in the database settings window.
steps.content: Click the "OK" button in the database settings window.

steps.title: Click on the Key icon.
steps.content: Click on the Key icon.

steps.title: Fill out the information for your first account.
steps.content: Fill out the information for your first account. Here, the example is a yahoo account. Type a title - for example, Yahoo. Type your username for that account. Type your password for that account. Confirm the password by typing it again. Click "OK."

steps.title: Review the details.
steps.content: Review the details. This is what your new entry will look like:

steps.title: Add any other accounts you want using the same process.
steps.content: Add any other accounts you want using the same process. For example, you can enter Gmail, MSN, Skype, Hotmail ,or any other type of accounts.

steps.title: Use a saved password.
steps.content: Use a saved password. To do this, go to the corresponding website and click the "Sign in" button.

steps.title: Bring up KeePass and right-click on your entry that you created.
steps.content: Bring up KeePass and right-click on your entry that you created. Select "Perform auto type."

steps.title: Download the app for iOS to use KeePass file on your iOS devices MiniKeePass.
steps.content: Download the app for iOS to use KeePass file on your iOS devices MiniKeePass.

steps.title: Upload your KeePass.kdbx (database file where the passwords are stored) to a cloud service such as Dropbox.
steps.content: Upload your KeePass.kdbx (database file where the passwords are stored) to a cloud service such as Dropbox. If you are unfamiliar with it, Dropbox article to learn more. Alternative info on uploading files to Dropbox can be found here

steps.title: Select the file.
steps.content: Select the file. Select button numbered one then select button numbered 2 "Open in".

steps.title: Choose an option titled "Open in MiniKeePass".
steps.content: Choose an option titled "Open in MiniKeePass". Please note depending on the number of apps on your phone, you may have to scroll to the right to find the MiniKeePass option. MiniKeePass will open to display your database(s) of stored passwords. Select it then login as needed.

steps.title: Navigate as needed to the location of your credentials.
steps.content: Navigate as needed to the location of your credentials. You could also just type out the name, either way that you prefer, once you've found the entry, select & open it.

steps.title: Tap the username and password fields until the option appears to copy.
steps.content: Tap the username and password fields until the option appears to copy. Friendly notice I find that there is approximately 30 seconds before the info is cleared out from the clipboard so don't delay in pasting in the info!

steps.title: Switch over to the app needing the credential via double tapping the Apple Home button twice to switch screens to select the app requesting login credentials.
steps.content: Switch over to the app needing the credential via double tapping the Apple Home button twice to switch screens to select the app requesting login credentials.

steps.title: Press then hold until you can paste in the credential.
steps.content: Press then hold until you can paste in the credential. Repeat this process until you can login.
